replies.body:
I don't want to be overly critical, but you're kinda downplaying how toxic this actually is. 

This isn't you _"overstepping my boundary"_, you told a player to kill themselves and questioned why they were not aborted as a fetus. This the single worst chat log I've ever seen on the boards. If you had've said this chat log in a public space IRL, you'd probably have community service right now. 

I think Riot is justified issuing an instant perma-ban here. Especially considering your second chat log is just as bad and massively homophobic.

I greatly appreciate your honesty though. Sharing chat logs with the community is always something I admire :)

Even it wasn't a perma ban, I'm sure as hell that the ban would be at least 2 months long considering the things you've typed, which in this case you might as well just level another account and take this as a lesson to not act vile and mean just because you can.

The reason to why you got a perm right out of the gate though, is probably because, or at least I suspect it to be that, they thought you're a smurf made by some guy who has a main account somewhere and is merely using this one as a low elo troll account to flame and say shit to people. It's quite popular among peeps who have nothing better to do, and is something Riot has been working hard trying to deal with, and I wouldn't be surprised if that's actually the reason why they give you perm right off the bat.

But then again, don't be a meanie sunshine.

IMO if you tell someone to kill themselves, I think the permaban without warning is deserved. 

Also, I would like to point out that it doesn't matter what your teammates are doing/saying, you should use your brain and not stoop to their level. Do what you are taught in kindergarten, and distance yourself from the negative behaviour. Mute them and play till the best of your ability until the end of the game, and report them if they are ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥.

Get over it, you could be toxic for the first time in your life and get perma banned off that. They have a machine dishing out that crap, no human touch.

People even get perma banned for "hacking and 3rd party" when they literally have nothing on their computer which fits that, they will also refuse to communicate with that player or take any logs from them. Ban are more of a "Who is the unlucky sod today" more than it is an actual punishment.

As a note, 14-day and perma bans are strictly reviewed and applied manually, meaning there most certainly is a "human touch".

As for "hacking and 3rd party software", there's a lot of stuff that can appear to the detection systems as being disallowed even though there might not be any explicit rule regarding that piece of software or it's purpose. It's a tricky situation to deal with whether reviews are done by the automated systems or by an actual Rioter. I've no doubt (personally) it's the worst category in regards to false positives but there's not much that can be done in that regard until Riot are able to find better detection methods for such kinds of disallowed software. As a general rule of thumb: if you're unsure just turn it off while you have LoL running.
I see now, rioter's go out of their way and perma ban people after 1 bad game, what an awesome strategy.

If you're going to be racist/homophobic/threatening or just generally excel in the realms of shitty people then you're gonna get banned real fast. This guy was well beyond your average "I just had a bad game and got really frustrated" kind of toxicity.
Not saying its not bad, I'm just saying in the past 6 months there have been quite a few perma bans for just 1 bad game.

I have yet to encounter one I felt was unjustified, with the exception of one that got reduced to a 14 day ban anyway. Obviously we have slightly different perspectives on this, but usually when I see instant permas like this it's first punishment but 2-3 games.  In fact I'm pretty sure the only time I've seen an instant perma with one game of logs was in cases where the player had multiple permabanned accounts for extreme behaviour already.

That said, if there's a specific case you had in mind I'd be happy to discuss it, these kinds of punishments are something I definitely find interesting, both in terms of how the system sees them and in the behaviour that triggers them.

>
> Not saying its not bad, I'm just saying in the past 6 months there have been quite a few perma bans for just 1 bad game.

Banned from 1 may be debatable depending on the situation, but OP had 2, where both of which he presented himself as the biggest ass in town. And thus he was banned.

Is perma justified? Well think of it this way.

They just got lvl 30 and their first ever Ranked matches was him being like that, even if it wasn't a perma, it would surely still be long enough for OP to level another account anyway. Hence while the account may be perma banned, it's actually not that big of a loss on their part, and it serves as a punishment and message just alright by having them re-level again.

In this instance for the purpose of this thread, I think there is no issue.

The system can issue 14 day and permanent bans, but for perma bans it is usually reviewed manually if not issued manually (to the best of my knowledge anyway).

It's also worth noting that the 3rd party scripting bans actually have the lowest rate of false positives, since there is very little wiggle room. If an illicit program has been detected, it's for a reason. I've only seen two false positives in my time as a lurker and later as a volunteer (that includes NA as well). 

One of those wasn't even really a false positive, but was rather a case of someone using a bannable program, being warned for it (back when they had a problem with things like custom skin programs that had other bad stuff in them), creating a new account but not properly removing said program and getting banned again despite not using it.

In the majority of the Ï swear I didn't use them" cases, it's because they've shared the account.

"vertigal blue: kill yourself"

Is what got you banned. The moment you say that you're done.
See you in 3 weeks crying about a deserved ban again.

> this chat log obviously doesnt show what my teammates were saying so naturally it comes off looking a lot worse

No, you're wrong there. It would come of just as bad if the other players chat logs were included. "They started it" is a childish excuse that I've not even heard a toddler use for years now. You're literally worse than every toddler I know.

Fact is, *you* did the wrong thing so that means *you* would get punished. If the other players were also doing the wrong thing they would also receive a punishment of some kind (assuming they were reported and there was enough of a reason to do so).

I'd say it's important to keep in mind that Riot would know if you have multiple accounts, so if the account in question (the one you're posting on now?) isn't your only account then Riot would likely be taking everything you've done on the other account into consideration, and given what's been shown in these chat logs I'm not at all surprised they've given you a perma-ban, even if this is your only account.

You're a terrible person and deserve to be perma-banned from every game (yes, even CoD) if this is the way you're going to behave.
